Allison Durkan

Allison is a junior studying computer engineering with a minor in electrical engineering, using her time as a research assistant in the CIDAR Lab to develop her software skills and to figure out what kind of research she is passionate about. Allison also enjoys playing water polo, reading and discovering new coffee shops. Allison has been rebuilding and restructuring Phagebook, creating a more intuitive user interface and testing the functionality of the components.

Phagebook Profile

Kathleen Lewis

Katie is a junior studying computer engineering with a minor in biomedical engineering. She is interested in developing computational tools to advance the synthetic biology and medical fields. Outside of school, she enjoys basketball, traveling, and photography. Katie has been developing the project management system within Phagebook, allowing researchers to easily design, document, and share projects amongst their lab members and the synthetic biology community.

Phagebook Profile

Inna Turshudzhyan

Inna is a junior studying Computer Engineering. She has been developing the Phagebook ordering system, which allows lab members to efficiently manage and order lab equipment and to keep track of lab requirements. Inna enjoys learning foreign languages, as well as ice-skating, piano and painting.

Phagebook Profile

Kara Lefort

Kara graduated in 2015 with a degree in biomedical engineering. During her time at BU Kara was involved with a variety of groups like Boston University Snowboarding Team, Engineers without Borders, intramural teams and Society of Women Engineers. She currently works at a startup, Moderna Therapeutics.
